channel.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
channel.description:
Post the parts of your favourite video games that you hated the most.
[b]Half Life 2[/b] - The part where you're with Alyx in Nova Prospekt and you have to set up the turrets and fight off waves of enemies.

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Morpheon
item.description:
The final boss of MegaMan X3, I died hundreds of times and had a sore thumb by the time I beat him, I got really lucky though. Oh, and the final boss of Megaman X4, I haven’t beaten the bastard until today… If you think I’m lying just look them up on YouTube!

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Halop
item.description:
Stalker: Clear Sky - The part when you leave the swamps and there is an army checkpoint with a mounted machine gun :fffuuu::fffuuu: . the MG shoots through trees and bushes with perfect accuarcy not to mention if you stay too long in one place you get grenade-spammed by advancing soldiers :fffuuu:

Mafia - The impossible freeride-extreme mission where you need to follow a plane on a car through the city, if you fall just a little behind, BOOM you die :’(

Deus ex - The Hong-kong district, dunno I always found that part of the game dull, especially the mapping, HL has better looking maps and it’s 2 years older. The only fun place in the level is when you brake in some chicks penthouse and find a secret entrance to an MJ12 base in a toilet

Half-life - The part in Xen where there are islands with tall spires. Lots of jumping and lots of those flying brains.

Homeworld 2 - Second level (or was it third), defend the shipyard :fffuuu::fffuuu:

Read full topic
item.source: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Pokemon_Eater
item.description:
ac3d:

Metroid Prime - Phazon Mines

Seriously? Fighting through dark caves, legions of elite pirates and research rooms and security centers was amazing, with the Omega Pirate being the cherry on top. Granted the first time I played through that game I was scared shitless because I was young and it was a pain in the ass because I only had eight energy tanks when I first played it. But try playing the Spider Guardian in Echoes with four, because when you’re that young you suck at item collecting and exploration.

Read full topic

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
How is it overwhelming? You go towards the striders, you throw a bomb at them, and then shoot it. Towards the end you begin to not be able to get to them, and then you just wait near the dispenser and easily throw magnussuns at them. It really isn’t hard at all.

As a side note, few times when you have to rush like crazy to meet objectives are monotonous. This was no exception.

Comrade Tiki:

They’re how “striders” should be spelled in order to not rhyme with “critters”.

Wut

Read full topic

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: blue
item.description:
or just go into the middle room and put the turrets so they look both sides and you can pick them up without going out of it ? Beat it on hard with losing almost no hp a week ago. I actually didnt consider it a bit hard until i noticed so many ppl have problems with it here ;D

And for the worst level ever it would have to be the ending straiders fight in half life 2 ep 2.
Everything about it sucks.

  1. You are supposed to navigate a level you see for first time with no minimap, you will get lost all the time unless you play it for few times.
  2. Way too much backtracking, the car should hold more than 1 bomb, its easier to save and load than to go for another one.
  3. You cant fucking see where you throw them, why do they cover half the screen and arent semi transparent or just under the crosshair ?
  4. There is no build up with less stariders so you can get to know the level, and figure out a tactic, they just all go at once form start.
  5. Most weapons are useless since there are only hunters coming, why the hell is there even ammo for them…
  6. Rest of the guys gets wiped by 1 hunter, why are they even there ?

Read full topic
item.source: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Grape_Flavor
item.description:
kewl:

Post the parts of your favourite video games that you hated the most.

Half Life 2 - The part where you’re with Alyx in Nova Prospekt and you have to set up the turrets and fight off waves of enemies.

If you’re talking about the part in the H-shaped corridor where they come in from 4 entrances, that part is easy.

Stack up boxes to create stairs back up to the elevated platform at one end of the H. Set up a line of turrets there and the Combine will all come through a narrow choke point and get mowed down.

When it’s over though Alyx will walk right past you and yell over the railing down to where you’re “supposed” to be. Jump back down and the scripting will work normally.

It’s not really cheating, just using your head!

Read full topic
item.source: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Imonfire:

Given the time constraint, you can’t really do anything else.

R…really??! You mean all this time, I felt like a cowardly aim-lacking douche, while in fact running was an acceptable solution?! This completely changes my outlook on life. To think, all this time I was being humble… and for naught…

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: Smoky
item.description:
Mass Effect 1 & 2 - (no jumping!) in almost every game you push the stinkin’ spacebar and you jump but not in ME, nope, push it 2 much & you get killed XD
Half Life 2 - sandtraps (finished it without touching the sand) it pisses me of when i have to pick up all those doors and SH** to get through the level.

  • ravenholm (finished it with the gravity gun only) how the hell am i suppose to kill those dumb flying zombies without the allmighty shotgun i had to run like hell when i lost all my saws and bricks XD (it got realy bloody after that)

Read full topic
item.source: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played

item.title: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
item.dc:creator: tycho_magnetic_anoma
item.description:
mattemuse:

amazing, you mean outside of the empty environments there is even more barren gameplay-less territory to explore? Fantastic!
And how could I forget those “trees and lizards,” truly I was wrong to ever doubt SOTC’s flourishing wild ecosystem. Really makes the world feel “alive.”

lol. Once again you miss the point. The world is supposed to feel dead, with Dormin’s presence. At the end of the game, the main characters retreat to an area that does flourish with life. there’s a bunch of deer, rabbits, turtles, a squirrel, doves, and owls. Obviously they could have used those assets in the rest of the forbidden land, but they didn’t, because it goes against the feeling that the forbidden land was once alive and thriving (evidenced by the various manmade structures), but is now almost completely dead.

Read full topic
item.source: Worst Part Of The Best Game(s) you've ever played
